column4: How do I delete a folder that it says i can not delete?    I want to remove /usr/src/linux-headers-2.6.27-9/arch/sh
why do you want to remove that folder?
just a duplicate of a makefile that i think may be the root of my dvd playback troubles, I don't have -9 on here.
i don't understand how a makefile can be the source of dvd playback trouble. Can you explain it? And do this for me and give me the output .. uname -a

http://paste.ubuntu.com/86121/       I can't get any dvd to play, I submitted a bug because we though we found the problem, they list it as answered now but I still don't have a fix, I've not had good luck with Ubuntu yet. Here is the link to my launchpad --> https://answers.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+question/54351
you have a specific reason not to be on the -9 kernel?
and do you have the libdvdcss package from medibuntu installed?
well i would always suggest to be on the latest kernel, which would be the -9 kernel in this case. You've tried the fix they gave? adding it to .bashrc
It wouldn't add to the .bashrc. At least when I looked at the files I saw nothing relating to dvdcss
that's because .bashrc isn't related to libdvdcss, dvdcss or anything for that matter. However, what you'll be adding there will affect all applications. Are you willing to try it?
if those links to the paste still work, that was exactly what was in those files
i know .bashrc :-) The effect would be that you won't have to set the env variable, because it's set as soon as you login.
can try, I got nothing to loose
alright. It's fairly easy actually, open up a terminal and copy this command to execute -->echo "export DVDCSS_METHOD=title" >> ~/.bashrc
then log out, back in, and see if it works.
